image_description: Ventricular Septal Defect (VSD) | American Heart Association
ai_description: This is an illustrative diagram of the heart demonstrating a ventricular septal defect (VSD), where there is an abnormal opening between the left and right ventricles.

image_description: Ventricular septal defect (VSD) - Symptoms & causes - Mayo Clinic
ai_description: This is a schematic illustration of the heart, demonstrating a ventricular septal defect in one image compared to a normal heart in the other.
This is an anatomical illustration of the heart depicting a ventricular septal defect (VSD), showing abnormal blood flow between the right and left ventricles through various types of defects.
This is an anatomical illustration of the heart demonstrating a ventricular septal defect, which allows for mixing of oxygen-rich and oxygen-poor blood between the left and right ventricles.
